alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 07 at 12:06PM CDT until June 08 at 2:36AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Caddo, Blaine, Custer and Canadian Counties.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC011-015-017-039-080515- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.W.0008.000000T0000Z-220608T0736Z/ /BRIO2.2.ER.220607T1343Z.220607T1800Z.220608T0136Z.NO/ 1206 PM CDT Tue Jun 7 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding affects croplands... pastures... and oil wells near the river. Flood plain fields at higher elevations away from the river may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. Sand dredging operations are affected. Upstream points in southern Blaine County may see flooding before the areas near Bridgeport in northern Caddo County. Downstream points in southwestern Canadian County are affected hours later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 16.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
